title: Lite XL Plugin Manager Manifest
$comment: TODO: Add our own uri format for <url>:<ref>.

addon-version.$comment: TODO: should we avoid limiting this to only 3 components? See lite-xl-lsp-servers -> lsp_json.

arch.description: Lite XL/Clang architecture tuple that the file is relevant for
List of architectures this file is relevant for

path.description: The location to install this file inside the addon's directory

optional.description: Whether the file is an optional addition. If omitted, the file is assumed to be required.

remotes.description: A simple array of string repository identifiers

addons.description: A simple array of string repository identifiers

id.description: The semantic id of the addon

version.description: The semantic version of the addon

mod_version.description: The mod_version this addon is compatible with

provides.description: Array of strings that are a shorthand of functionality this addon provides. Can be used as a dependency.

replaces.description: Array of ids that this plugin explicitly replaces. Will always prefer this plugin in place of those plugins, so long as version requirements are met.

remote.description: Public https git link where this addon is located

optional.description: Determines whether the dependency is optional

conflicts.description: Table of addons that conflict with the current one
conflicts.$comment: TODO: The spec says in the same format as `dependencies`, but I don't think this supports `optional`.

tags.description: Freeform tags that may describe attributes of the addon
tags.$comment: TODO: Should we limit the tag format? For example to #/definitions/addon-id

path.description: The path to the addon in the repository. If omitted, will only pull the files in files. To pull the whole repository, use ".".

arch.description: List of architectures this plugin supports. If not present, and no `files` entry specifies arches, the plugin is valid for all architectures. Otherwise uses the arches specified in `files` entries.

post.description: Commands to run after the addon is installed

url.description: URL which specifies a direct download link to a single lua file. Precludes the use of `remote`, `path`.

checksum.description: SHA256 digest of the file specified in `url`

extra.description: Dictionary which holds any desired extra information

files.description: Files that are downloaded and placed inside the addon directory. If the file is an archive, it will be automatically extracted.

lite-xls.description: Represents the different versions of Lite XL that are registered in this repository

mod_version.description: The modversion the binary corresponds to

files.description: Files that are downloaded. If the file is an archive, it will be automatically extracted. Conventionally, there should be a single file per architecture that is a `.tar.gz` or `.zip` containing all necessary files for Lite XL to run.
